content.description: Millenium Falcon has fun slab climbing in an awesome setting. It is a natural feature that travels up the right side of the wall, just under vertical and very bouldery. It has two well-defined cruxes with awesome stances.
content.protection: 12 bolts to a two bolt anchor!
content.location:
Rappel the

Han Solo

route. If need be, clean the crack out on the way down...a little public service. The route is very obvious. It starts on the right side of the wall.

content.description: Rappel down the face of the dark side to the base of the cliff (2 raps with one 60m rope). The crack angles on the left side of the wall. A tricky crux down low leads to secure jamming or nice edging and laybacking. The route breaks up nicely into two pitches. From the top of the first pitch anchor, climb straight up on easy terrain protected by gear for about 30 feet. Climb under an obvious roof, and clip a bolt at the lip of the roof. From there, pull the roof, and climb the face up and right through the steepest / best looking rock straight up to the anchors that you first rapped from. Bolts and a single set of cams protect the second pitch. Both pitches are 100' long.
content.protection: A single rack of Cams up to a #3, 1 set of Aliens, 1 set of nuts, and quickdraws. That is probably more gear than necessary, but it seems to do well on every Vallecito climb.
content.location: This is at The Dark Side...oh yeah.
